alert.note: Alert for West Marshall; West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 8:13PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Kittson, western Marshall, northwestern Polk, Benson, southern Cavalier, northern Grand Forks, northwestern Griggs, Ramsey, Walsh, Pembina, southern Towner, Nelson and Eddy Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 813 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pembina to near Mandt to near Wellsburg. Movement was south at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Conway, Forest River and Forest River Colony around 825 PM CDT. Inkster, Bowesmont and Johnstown around 830 PM CDT. Orr and Gilby around 835 PM CDT. Drayton, Robbin and Honeyford around 840 PM CDT. Herrick, Turtle River State Park and Cashel around 845 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include American Crystal Sugar. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 149 and 217. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
